chunks.text: It's been a roller coaster for a lot of people that are in not only crypto markets, but also traditional markets. It's been wild swings left, right, and center. And if you've been in crypto, you've probably witnessed this as well over the last couple of days. $2,000 pump, $3,300 dump, two $3,200 pump back towards the upside. Uh what happens next, right? That's the question. We'll also talk about why this is happening. Why are we seeing these world swings? and doesn't mean that the market is back. You can always go through to the poll section over here and you can vote. Did Trump's Davos speech where he of course said a whole lot which caused this type of price movement um you know save crypto has it saved not only the crypto markets but also the traditional markets. 20% of you believe or 21 now believe that we're back. 42% believe we're just going to continue to range and then 34% believe not even Trump can save Bitcoin over here. Um, and it's been like this. This has been the true story, right? Every day Trump, I might do something wild, stocks dump. I might do or I might not do something while stocks pump. But what if I just stocks dump? Oh, come on, man. I was just kidding. And stocks pump. We saw some of the commodities dump in the moment. We saw the equities begin to spike back up and consequently crypto as a higher beta play or a more aggressive trade move back towards the upside as well. But can it remain? Well, an important thing to understand is when you see heavily news-driven markets, you want to do what's called reading the tape. So, when you start to see uh news-driven events create price to move back towards the upside, when you're already broken down some key levels and therefore in the start of a downtrend on the lower time frames and price can't maintain those levels following these news-driven events. Well, that is called reading the tape and it's telling you the tape is telling you that the market is still bearish.
